required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Effect of Oral Temanogrel on Digital Blood Flow in Adult Participants With Raynaud's Phenomenon Secondary to Systemic Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Crossover Study to Assess the Effect of Oral Temanogrel on Digital Blood Flow in Subjects With Raynaud's Phenomenon Secondary to Systemic Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether oral temanogrel improves digital blood flow in participants with Raynaud's phenomenon secondary to systemic sclerosis (SSc-RP) as a potential safe and effective treatment for symptoms associated with SSc-RP.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be conducted in 2 stages: Stage A and Stage B. In both stages, participants will be equally randomized in a double-blind manner to a 3-period crossover treatment sequence. Separate cohorts of participants will participate in each stage. In Stage A, participants will be treated with two dose levels of temanogrel and placebo. Doses in Stage B will be determined based on the results of Stage A.

primary_outcome.measure: Rewarming Area Under the Curve (AUC) as Assessed With Infrared (IR) Thermography
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes following a cold challenge

primary_outcome.measure: Reperfusion AUC as Assessed With Laser Speckle Contrast Imaging (LSCI)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Reduction Following a Cold Challenge as Assessed With IR Thermography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Reduction Following a Cold Challenge as Assessed With LSCI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Recovery During the 30 Minutes Following a Cold Challenge as Assessed With IR Thermography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Recovery During the 30 Minutes Following a Cold Challenge as Assessed With LSCI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC During the Initial 2 Minutes Following a Cold Challenge as Assessed With IR Thermography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC During the Initial 2 Minutes Following a Cold Challenge as Assessed With LSCI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Slope During the Initial 2 Minutes Following a Cold Challenge as Assessed With IR Thermography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Slope During the Initial 2 Minutes Following a Cold Challenge as Assessed With LSCI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Achieve 50% Recovery From the Cold Challenge-induced Reduction as Assessed With IR Thermography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Achieve 50% Recovery From the Cold Challenge-induced Reduction as Assessed With LSCI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Achieve 70% Recovery From the Cold Challenge-induced Reduction as Assessed With IR Thermography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Achieve 70% Recovery From the Cold Challenge-induced Reduction as Assessed With LSCI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 30 minutes following a cold challenge

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose to Postdose in Room Temperature Values as Assessed With IR Thermography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose for 5 minutes at room temperature and at Postdose prior to cold challenge for 5 minutes at room temperature

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose to Postdose in Room Temperature Values as Assessed With LSCI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose for 5 minutes at room temperature and at Postdose prior to cold challenge for 5 minutes at room temperature

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose to Postdose in Distal Dorsal Difference (DDD), Assessed With IR Thermography
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose for 5 minutes at room temperature and at Postdose prior to cold challenge for 5 minutes at room temperature
secondary_outcome.description: DDD is defined as the difference in measurements between the dorsum and the finger at room temperature

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Predose to Postdose in DDD as Assessed With LSCI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose for 5 minutes at room temperature and at Postdose prior to cold challenge for 5 minutes at room temperature
secondary_outcome.description: DDD is defined as the difference in measurements between the dorsum and the finger at room temperature

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and Severity of Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study Day 1 through approximately 47 days for each stage of the study
secondary_outcome.description: Safety will be assessed by monitoring adverse events and clinically relevant changes in vital signs and clinical laboratory results.

clinical_study.condition: Raynaud's Phenomenon Secondary to Systemic Sclerosis

intervention.description: Participants will receive a single oral dose of temanogrel during the treatment visit.
Participants will receive a single oral dose of temanogrel matching placebo during the treatment visit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Raynaud's phenomenon (defined as a history of digital cold sensitivity associated with color changes of cyanosis and pallor, with on average at least 5 attacks per week during the winter period) secondary to systemic sclerosis (SSc)
- Both men and women participants agree to use a highly effective method of birth control if the possibility of conception exists
- Body mass index 18.0 to 40.0 kilograms per square meter (kg/m^2), inclusive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active digital ulcer(s), recent history (within 3 months of Screening) of digital ulcers, or history of recurrent digital ulcerations that in the opinion of the Investigator increase the likelihood of developing a digital ulcer during the course of the study. Any history of gangrene, amputations, or other critical digital ischemic event
- Raynaud's phenomenon due to any cause other than SSc
- Severe gastrointestinal complications related to SSc that in the opinion of the Investigator could significantly affect study drug absorption
- History of gastrointestinal bleeding or active gastric or duodenal ulcers
